item.title: Report X-2024010048
item.description:
Report X-2024010048

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-24
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE HANDLING OF AN AIR DECLARED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL PACKAGE CONTAINING HYDROCHLORIC ACID, THE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE BURST OPEN SPILLING THE INNER DANGEROUS GOOD CONTENTS. VAPORS AND FUMES BEGAN RELEASING CAUSING ONE WING OF THE FACILITY TO BE TEMPORARILY EVACUATED. OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CONTACTED TO RESPOND TO THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE CONTAINED 6 X 2.5 L GLASS BOTTLES OF HYDROCHLORIC ACID. TWO BOTTLES SHATTERED UPON HITTING THE CONCRETE FLOOR. THE BOTTLES MADE CONTACT WITH THE RIGHT SHIN AND FOOT OF THE PACKAGE HANDLER. EMPLOYEE REMOVED THE AFFECTED CLOTHING AND WAS SENT TO CONCENTRA URGENT CARE AS A PRECAUTIONARY MEASURE FOR POSSIBLE EXPOSURE. AFTER EXAMINATION THE EMPLOYEE WAS CLEARED TO RETURN TO WORK. A SECOND AIR DECLARED PACKAGE CONTAINING UN1090, ACETONE, PG II ALSO APPEARED TO BE LEAKING UNDER TRACKING 1Z18131X0101754877. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING ACCOUNT NUMBER 18131X, SPECTRUM LABORATORY PROD INC. 769 JERSEY AVE. NEW BRUNSWICK NJ 08901.

item.description:
Report I-2023120065

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-16
  • City: Erlanger
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12/16/2023, during the cargo processing, a package was reported as damaged. Upon further inspection, the inner packaging was broken and released all contained commodity. This incident occurred at the CVG HUB, 236 Wendell H Ford Blvd, Erlanger KY 41018. Transportation by air has been confirmed.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap began to leak and QA was called. We cleaned up the spilled product with absorbent pads, secured the cap and placed the package in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap leaked DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was placed in a lined red tote.
